Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a pale-red pottery meat-jar, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and with remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text specifying the contents as pressed meat for a festival from the store of a king's scribe (name unclear).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (389880) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/389880)
